meanings.definition: A person who is excessively concerned with minor details and rules.
meanings.sent1: My aunt is a fussbudget when it comes to arranging the table for dinner.
meanings.sent2: The office fussbudget always insists on everyone following the dress code to the letter.
meanings.sent3: The fussbudget in our group made sure every pencil on the desk was perfectly aligned.
meanings.sent4: She was a fussbudget about keeping her shoes in pristine condition, never a scuff in sight.
meanings.sent5: The fussbudget's obsession with organizing her bookshelf by color was both impressive and amusing.

meanings.definition: To complain or worry about trivial matters.
meanings.sent1: Don't fussbudget over the small stain on the tablecloth; it's hardly noticeable.
meanings.sent2: She tends to fussbudget about the weather forecast even when it's sunny outside.
meanings.sent3: I couldn't help but fussbudget about the crooked picture frame on the wall.
meanings.sent4: He would fussbudget about every decision, unable to make up his mind.
meanings.sent5: The child would fussbudget over which color crayon to use, unable to pick just one.
